instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 water damaged
threads.message:
I have 820-3115 water damaged
No keyboard or trackpad after repairing the water damage, it boot and i can get to the system. 
The fan is spinning fast, I think there is a sensor issue. 
I checked ot with Hardware monitor, sensor reading of memory module 1 128, i think it is damaged. Where it is located ? 
PP3V3_S4 is 1.92v i think this is why there is no keyboard and trackpad. 
Any advice ? 
Thanks

threads.title: 820-3115 water damaged
threads.message:
Post Q7800/03 voltages.
Check diode mode on 3V3_S4 w/ and w/o TP connected.

threads.title: 820-3115 water damaged
threads.message:
"Q7800/03 3.3v"
Please, read the posts with atention!
I asked you to post voltages for Q7800 and Q7803...

threads.title: 820-3115 water damaged
threads.message:
Sorry about that, 
the board boot just with battery, i found this not normal.
i tried to replace SMC, same result  
pin 1 0.1v
pin 3 3.2v
Q7800
pin  3 3.0v
pin 1 1.9v
pin 4,7 3.3v

threads.title: 820-3115 water damaged
threads.message:
"pin 1 0.1v
pin 3 3.2v"
Are these Q7803 readings?
3V3S4_EN must be present, if you can boot the machine.
Post now U7970 voltages.

threads.title: 820-3115 water damaged
threads.message:
yes
Q7803
pin 1 0.1v
pin 3 3.2v

U7970  
PIN 1 3.3v
pin 2 3.3
pin 4 0.2v
pin 6 3.3v
